title: Authorizes the commissioner of general services to release a right of reverter in letters patent conveying certain land located in the city of Buffalo
summary: Authorizes the commissioner of general services to release a right of reverter in letters patent conveying certain land located in the city of Buffalo.

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

       Introduced  by M. of A. GANTT -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Governmental Operations

       AN ACT to amend chapter 616 of the laws of 1992, relating to authorizing
         the conveyance of state land in the city  of  Buffalo,  to  Women  for
         Human  Rights  and Dignity Development Corporation Inc. for charitable
         purposes, in relation  to  authorizing  the  commissioner  of  general
         services  to  release  a right of reverter in letters patent conveying
         certain land located in the city of Buffalo, county of Erie

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Chapter  616 of the laws of 1992, relating to authorizing
    2  the conveyance of state land in the city of Buffalo to Women  for  Human
    3  Rights   and   Dignity  Development  Corporation,  Inc.  for  charitable
    4  purposes, is amended to read as follows:
    5    Section 1. The commissioner  of  general  services  in  the  executive
    6  department  [is  hereby  authorized  to sell and convey to the Women for
    7  Human Rights and Dignity Development Corporation, Inc., a not-for-profit
    8  corporation in the state of New York, the lands  with  the  improvements
    9  thereon]  MAY,  BY  ORDER,  CANCEL  ANY  CONDITION  OR RIGHT OF REVERTER
   10  CONTAINED IN LETTERS PATENT, CONVEYING CERTAIN  PREMISES,  more  partic-
   11  ularly described in section [three] TWO of this act, UPON APPLICATION OF
   12  THE  SUCCESSOR  IN INTEREST TO THE ORIGINAL GRANTEE, IF THE COMMISSIONER
   13  IS SATISFIED BY REASON OR PROOF SUBMITTED THAT SUCH CANCELLATION IS JUST
   14  AND NOT DETRIMENTAL TO THE INTERESTS OF THE STATE. THE  ORDER  SHALL  BE
   15  UPON  TERMS  AND  CONDITIONS  INCLUDING  PAYMENT  OF  FAIR AND EQUITABLE
   16  CONSIDERATION AS DETERMINED BY SAID COMMISSIONER.
   17    S 2. [The purpose of this conveyance  is  to  develop,  implement  and
   18  monitor  activities  which  are exclusively charitable, with the primary
   19  intent of providing educational relief  to  those  individuals  who  are
   20  disadvantaged,  particularly  women.  Conveyance  shall  be on terms and

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.

    1  conditions, including consideration,  as  the  commissioner  of  general
    2  services may fix and determine.
    3    S 3.] The premises are more particularly described as follows:
    4    All  that  tract  or  parcel  of land, situate in the city of Buffalo,
    5  county of Erie, state of New York and being part of Lot 65, Township 11,
    6  Range 8 of the Holland Land Company Survey (so-called) and further being
    7  part of subdivision lot 12 in block "F" as shown on a map filed  in  the
    8  Erie  county  clerk's office under cover no.  254, bounded and described
    9  as follows:
   10    Beginning at a point on the northwesterly boundary of Main  street  at
   11  its  intersection  with  the  southwesterly boundary of Florence avenue;
   12  running thence southwesterly along the northwesterly  boundary  of  Main
   13  street,  a distance of 50.0 feet to a point. Said point being the south-
   14  easterly corner of subdivision lot  12;  running  thence  northwesterly,
   15  parallel  with  the  southwesterly boundary of Florence avenue and along
   16  the southwesterly line of subdivision lot 12, a distance of  140.0  feet
   17  to a point; running thence northeasterly, parallel with the northwester-
   18  ly  boundary  of  Main street, a distance of 50.0 feet to a point on the
   19  southwesterly boundary of Florence avenue; running thence  southeasterly
   20  along the southwesterly boundary of Florence avenue, a distance of 140.0
   21  feet to the point or place of beginning.
   22    Together  with  all  the right, title and interest of the party of the
   23  first part of, in and to any land lying in the bed of any highway, road,
   24  street or avenue, land or alley, open or proposed, lying in front of  or
   25  adjacent to the premises conveyed hereunder to the centerline thereof.
   26    Being  the  same  premises  conveyed to the people of the state of New
   27  York by Florence B. Lunz by deed dated November 14,  1975  and  recorded
   28  December  9,  1975  in  the  Erie county clerk's office in liber 8345 of
   29  deeds at page 523, said  premises  being  known  as  2238  Main  Street,
   30  Buffalo, New York.
   31    [S  4. Any lands transferred pursuant to this act shall be used exclu-
   32  sively to develop, implement and monitor activities which are exclusive-
   33  ly charitable, with the primary intent of providing  educational  relief
   34  to  those individuals who are disadvantaged, particularly women and upon
   35  termination of such use, title to the lands so transferred shall  revert
   36  to the state of New York.
   37    S  5.]  S  3. The commissioner of general services shall not grant the
   38  aforesaid lands unless application is  made  therefor  within  one  year
   39  after the date on which this act shall have become a law.
   40    [S 6.] S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
   41    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
